issues.summary: Funnel Navigation improvements: Back button from the Recipe Selection page should take customer to Plan Selection page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Expected Outcome*

The expected outcome is ‚Ä¶

When customer click on the ‚Äúback‚Äù button on the recipe (meal) selection page customer should navigate back to the Plan selection page. (Please note: the back button on the browser correctly navigates customer to the plan selection page). See issue in the video attached.

Currently, clicking on the ‚Äúback‚Äù button on the recipe selection page, navigates customers back to the step 1 of the onboarding quiz, which results in customers asked to fill in the essential questions again and wait for the calorie calculation.

Navigating the customer back in the funnel leads to decline in conversion and decline in customer trust with PetsTable digital experience.

*Data required for prioritization:* In what % of sessions, customer click on the ‚Äúback‚Äù button of the recipe selection page. 


{panel}

h3. *Scope (choose one):* {color:#97A0AF}*[ TBD ]*{color}  {color:#FF5630}*[ FIX THE BROKEN ]*{color}  {color:#FF991F}*[ SOLVE UNMET NEEDS ]*{color} {color:#36B37E}*[ ABOVE AND BEYOND NEEDS ]*{color} {color:#00B8D9}*[ INNOVATE ]*{color} 

||*What is the problem we‚Äôre solving for customers?*|Customers currently have to navigate through the questionnaire again if they click on the back button on the recipe selection page. 
As we aim to have a variety of meal plans to offer customers, this will increase the time it takes for customers to make a satisfactory meal plan/recipe choice for their pet.  
Allowing easier navigation from recipe to plan selection page will allow customers to make a decision quickly and move forward in the funnel to address/payment pages.|
||*Why will customers care if we work on this?*|Customers expect the ‚Äúback‚Äù button on recipe selection page to perform the expected action - take them back to plan selection page. Navigating customers back to the step 1 of questionnaire increases effort to complete transaction and reduce customer trust with TPT digital experience.|
||*What company strategy bene
issues.assignee: Andrea Martins Costa L F Nascimento

issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: allergens.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62333
133 test runs, 31 test failures, 90 test retries, 77.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62333 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Hey [~accountid:611f5f139fd388006a857686] [~accountid:6303a65d4c25135b9720b173] 

I‚Äôm checking Contentfu to identify which content type we can use for the reviews. We have [Testimonial|https://app.contentful.com/spaces/4frik3v39clf/entries/16yU18dWkvg7TGMNPxCSte?focusedField=identifier] type, but it has only these fields:
- Reviewer name
- Content (body of the review)
- Reviewer image
- Date
- Review type (reviewed or recommended) 
- Stars

According to Figma we also need Title and verified purc

[GD] AQA | Add E2E tests for Different portions parcentage
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

* Validate one additional step in the Quiz with a question regarding a different portion percentage (is this under feature flag? -if so, which one)
* Validate different flows for the answer to this question in the Quiz:
** User selects {{full}} meal ‚Üí user should see 100% percentage of portions by default, no other options are available
** User selects {{mix}} ‚Üí user should see 50% percentage of portions by default, options for 75% and 100% are available. Changes are in images (wouldn‚Äôt be covered) and price (do we need to check it as well?)
** User selects {{not sure}} ‚Üí user should see 100% percentage by default, options for 50% and 75% are available. Changes are in images (wouldn‚Äôt be covered) and price (do we need to check it as well?)
* Validate that for {{mix}} and {{not sure}}: 
** options 50% and 75% (and 100%) are available for all meal plans, except the {{Mix plan}}
** options 50% and 75% (and 100%) are available only when calculated calories > 225 
** option 75% and 100% are available only when the plan calculates calories in 150-225
** Only option 100% is available for the plan in the 88-149 calorie range (is it covered, or should it be done in the scope of this ticket?)

*Flow 1:*

Steps:

# Go to {{/plans-quiz}}page
# Go through the Quiz till step 10 (mocked data to appear in this step of the Quiz?). Important to have planned calories > 225 ‚Üí Validate 3 options are available
# User chooses the {{mix}} option.
# On meal selection plan {{/plans-selection?calories=226&isPuppy=false}} ‚Üí Validate that {{Air-Dried}} and {{Fresh}} plans have 50, 75, and 100 options. The 50 option is chosen by default.
# Click on different portion options ‚Üí Check changes in prices
# Select a plan to continue ‚Üí User is redirected to {{/select-meals}}

*Flow 2:* with the steps from the previous flow: On step 3, the user chooses the {{not sure}} option ‚Üí Check that on the plan‚Äôs selection page, the default is 100, and other options are avail

issues.summary: Migrate add-on selection calls from subscribable-addons-bff to normal cart endpoint
When user changes their plan their delivery plan is updated with a regular delivery option
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

Whenever a user changes their plan, their delivery option is also updated based on 2 factors: 

* What delivery options are available for their new plan (E.g. Monday delivery might only be available for dry plans)
* To match the cadence of their new plan

After we migrated to use CDPS to handle cadence, delivery option no longer handles cadence so the second point won‚Äôt be necessary once we remove the cadence delivery options. In that case we want to implement a change behind the FF to only take into account picking the right delivery day for the new plan and only utilise regular delivery options (no {{-*WEEKLY}} postfix) 
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria* *_(focus on the what, not the how)_*

* +*To make sure this works as expected we should validate the following cases:*+
** Switching between plans that have different cadences
** Switching between plans that have different delivery days available
* If FF is on
** Cadence is update correctly
** User‚Äôs delivery day is updated as expected
** User‚Äôs deliveries are updated as expected
** Delivery option should not include cadence (i.e no {{-*WEEKLY}})
*** Needs to be checked in the network requests because this isn‚Äôt visible through the UI
* If FF is off (BAU):
** Cadence is update correctly
** User‚Äôs delivery days is updated as expected
** User‚Äôs deliveries are updated as expected
** User‚Äôs delivery option should be updated to reflect the new cadence
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*Developer Information* 

* [Code responsible for plan change API calls|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/plan-change-confirmation/hooks/useUpdateSubscriptionPlan.ts]
{panel}

links.summary: When user changes cadence their delivery option should not be updated

comments.author: Mariia Oleksiuk
comments.body:
*_Test the experiment_*

# Go through funnel flow with either variation_1 or variation_2 for {{tpt_portion_percentage}} and confirm that Portion percentage options are displayed
# Go through funnel flow with control and confirm the Portion percentage options are not displayed

links.summary: [GD] Render portion percentage options for all plan cards

issues.summary: [GD] Render portion percentage options for all plan cards
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

Render the correct set of portion percentage options on each plan card based on:

* user‚Äôs quiz answer,
** *Full meals* ‚Üí portions are hidden.
** *Mix with other food* ‚Üí portions are displayed, with 50% selected by default.
** *Not sure yet* ‚Üí portions are displayed, with 100% selected by default.
* Not all calorie ranges will have a 50% or 75% option available, for smaller dogs this might not be available
** Active experience:
*** <87 - no plan
*** Between 88-149 - offer only 100% plan for dry and fresh
**** +This is handled by the NMPS API+
*** Between 150-225 - offer 100% and 75% plan for dry and fresh
*** 226+ - offer mixed plan + 50% 75% and 100% percentages for dry and fresh
**** +This has to be implemented in the FE because the API returns mixed plan for 50/75% portions+
** In the funnel:
*** <87 - no plan
*** Between 88-149 - offer only 100% plan for dry and fresh
**** +This is handled by the NMPS API+
*** Between 150-225 - offer 100% and 75% plan for dry and fresh
*** 226+ - offer mixed plan + 50% and 100% percentages for dry and fresh
**** +This has to be implemented in the FE because the API returns mixed plan for 50/75% portions+

Some of this logic is already implemented on API side, rest logic should be implemented on frontend side


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Resources*

* Design: [Figma|https://www.figma.com/design/e52lJP7qObpz16Tbh2ALBP/-SBD-2490--Mixing-in-the-Funnel?node-id=22333-8410&t=9y20tZahzJWSW9vx-0]
* Scope: [Google doc|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UiptyNxTPvqBvDKavC9B0v8brSHhr0FiSVvxr6xr5x4/edit?tab=t.7rn9wrcbmf4a] 
* Content, etc
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#ffebe6}
*Out of Scope* 

* If applicable, when the task/feature is split into multiple tickets
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria* *_(focus on the what, not the how)_*

* Uses API data and quiz info to determine which options are visible.
* Different sets of portion options are rendered for the funnel and active exp

issues.description:
Stakeholder request:
[https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1763747943463139|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1763747943463139|smart-link] 

Skus to be added for respective product family:

Findings:

- Refactor [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/2133f95084f731b309f0eb89f5da8e60697d810e/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/variable-cadences/useSkuCadenceMap.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/2133f95084f731b309f0eb89f5da8e60697d810e/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/variable-cadences/useSkuCadenceMap.ts]  and migrate the static config usage {{ selectDeliveryOptionsSkuCadencesMap }} and replace it with the config useDeliveryOptionsConfig: [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/776bc8006cf2ee758b33529c69091f9392de1ac4/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/config/deliveryOptions/useDeliveryOptionsConfig.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/776bc8006cf2ee758b33529c69091f9392de1ac4/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/config/deliveryOptions/useDeliveryOptionsConfig.ts] 

- Add new skus to [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/776bc8006cf2ee758b33529c69091f9392de1ac4/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/config/deliveryOptions/config.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/776bc8006cf2ee758b33529c69091f9392de1ac4/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/config/deliveryOptions/config.ts] under the correct cadence section

- Add the new skus to our product skus config
[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/2d248483275948b70beffc84ce9348653749ac9f/app/operations/config-definitions/whitelabel-product-skus-config/config/overrides_KN.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/2d248483275948b70beffc84ce9348653749ac9f/app/operations/config-definitions/whitelabel-product-skus-config/config/overrides_KN.ts]

issues.summary: Complete full production rollout
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Complete the production rollout to 100% traffic after successful canary validation.

h2. Tasks

* Approve promotion to 100% traffic
* Monitor metrics during full rollout
* Verify all functionality in production
* Update status in Jira and Slack
* Celebrate successful launch! üéâ

h2. Post-Rollout Validation

* [ ] All pods healthy and serving traffic
* [ ] Error rate within normal range
* [ ] Latency within SLO
* [ ] No increase in support tickets
* [ ] Downstream services (NMPS) healthy

h2. Communication

* Notify stakeholders of successful deployment
* Update ADR with lessons learned
* Share metrics on initial performance

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] 100% traffic served by BFF
* [ ] Metrics stable for 24 hours
* [ ] No critical issues reported
* [ ] Stakeholders notified

h2. Dependencies

* Deploy to production with canary rollout

issues.summary: Deploy to production with canary rollout
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Deploy meal-plans BFF to production using progressive delivery (canary deployment).

h2. Tasks

* Create production release
* Trigger canary deployment via ArgoCD
* Monitor metrics during canary phase (10% traffic)
* Validate error rate and latency within SLO
* Progress through canary steps (10% ‚Üí 50%)
* Monitor for issues at each step
* Document any issues encountered

h2. Canary Steps

# 10% traffic - Monitor for 15 min
# 50% traffic - Monitor for 15 min
# 100% traffic - Full rollout

h2. Rollback Triggers

* Error rate > 5%
* P99 latency > 2s
* Any critical alerts fired

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Canary deployed successfully
* [ ] Metrics within SLO during rollout
* [ ] No rollback required
* [ ] Ready for full rollout

h2. Dependencies

* Deploy to staging environment
* Configure progressive delivery (canary deployment)

issues.summary: Conduct on-call onboarding session
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Train Pet Food squad on operating and maintaining the meal-plans BFF.

h2. Tasks

* Schedule pairing session with Pet Food squad
* Walk through architecture and code structure
* Demo Grafana dashboards and key metrics
* Demo Loki log queries
* Demo ArgoCD deployment process
* Practice incident response scenarios
* Answer questions and gather feedback

h2. Session Agenda (suggested 2 hours)

# Architecture overview (20 min)
# Code walkthrough (30 min)
# Monitoring demo (20 min)
# Deployment demo (20 min)
# Incident simulation (20 min)
# Q&A (10 min)

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Session scheduled and conducted
* [ ] Pet Food squad comfortable with operations
* [ ] Access verified for all team members
* [ ] Feedback incorporated into docs

h2. Dependencies

* Create on-call documentation and runbooks
* Deploy to staging environment

issues.summary: Create on-call documentation and runbooks
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Document operational procedures for on-call engineers managing the meal-plans BFF.

h2. Tasks

* Create runbook for common issues
* Document how to check logs in Loki
* Document how to use Grafana dashboards
* Document how to deploy via ArgoCD
* Document rollback procedures
* Add troubleshooting guide

h2. Runbook Sections

# *Service Overview*: Architecture, dependencies, endpoints
# *Monitoring*: Grafana dashboards, key metrics to watch
# *Logging*: Loki queries, common log patterns
# *Deployment*: ArgoCD access, deploy/rollback steps
# *Troubleshooting*: Common issues and solutions
# *Escalation*: Who to contact, when to escalate

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Runbook covers all operational scenarios
* [ ] Loki query examples provided
* [ ] Grafana dashboard linked
* [ ] Rollback procedure documented
* [ ] Accessible to Pet Food squad

h2. Dependencies

* Deploy to staging environment
* Create Grafana dashboard for meal-plans BFF

issues.summary: Deploy to staging environment
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Deploy the first version of meal-plans BFF to staging environment and validate functionality.

h2. Tasks

* Trigger release workflow to build and push Docker image
* Deploy to staging via ArgoCD
* Verify application starts successfully
* Test all endpoints in staging
* Verify logs appear in Loki
* Verify metrics appear in Grafana
* Verify traces in tracing system

h2. Validation Checklist

* [ ] Application pods running and healthy
* [ ] /status endpoint returns 200
* [ ] /metrics endpoint returns Prometheus format
* [ ] /docs endpoint shows Swagger UI
* [ ] All API endpoints functional
* [ ] Authentication working with HF JWT
* [ ] NMPS backend connectivity working

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] BFF deployed and running in staging
* [ ] All endpoints tested and working
* [ ] Observability stack connected
* [ ] No critical errors in logs

h2. Dependencies

* All implementation tasks completed

issues.summary: Write e2e tests for API endpoints
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create end-to-end tests to verify API behavior with real HTTP requests.

h2. Tasks

* Set up e2e test configuration with supertest
* Create test fixtures and helpers
* Write e2e tests for all endpoints
* Test authentication flows
* Test validation error responses
* Configure e2e tests in CI

h2. Test Scenarios

# Successful CRUD operations
# Authentication required (401)
# Validation errors (400)
# Not found errors (404)
# Server errors (500)

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] E2e tests for all endpoints
* [ ] Auth scenarios tested
* [ ] Validation tested
* [ ] Tests run in CI pipeline

h2. Dependencies

* Write unit tests for handlers

issues.summary: Set up OpsGenie team integration
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Configure OpsGenie team for Pet Food squad to receive alerts and manage on-call rotation.

h2. Tasks

* Create or configure OpsGenie team for Pet Food
* Set up on-call rotation schedule
* Configure alert routing from Prometheus
* Set up escalation policies
* Add team members to rotation

h2. Configuration

* Team: Pet Food Squad (or New Ventures)
* Rotation: Weekly (adjust as needed)
* Escalation: 5 min to backup, 15 min to decide on incident sev, ‚Ä¶.

h2. Reference

* [HF OpsGenie Setup|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/prometheus/docs/thanos/observability/05-Incident-Management/01-infrastructure-components/03-opsgenie-team-setup/]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] OpsGenie team configured
* [ ] On-call rotation set up
* [ ] Alerts route to correct team
* [ ] Escalation policy defined

h2. Dependencies

* Configure alerting rules

issues.summary: Configure alerting rules
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Define Prometheus alerting rules for meal-plans BFF to detect issues proactively.

h2. Tasks

* Create alerting rules for error rate threshold
* Create alerting rules for latency threshold
* Create alerting rules for resource exhaustion
* Configure alert severity levels
* Set up alert routing to OpsGenie

h2. Alert Rules

# High Error Rate: >5% 5xx errors for 5 min ‚Üí Warning
# Critical Error Rate: >10% 5xx errors for 2 min ‚Üí Critical
# High Latency: p99 > 2s for 5 min ‚Üí Warning
# Pod Restarts: >3 restarts in 10 min ‚Üí Warning
# Memory Pressure: >85% memory for 10 min ‚Üí Warning

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Alerting rules deployed
* [ ] Alerts fire correctly in staging tests
* [ ] Alert severity appropriate
* [ ] Runbook links in alert descriptions

h2. Dependencies

* Create Grafana dashboard for meal-plans BFF

issues.summary: Create Grafana dashboard for meal-plans BFF
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create Grafana dashboard for monitoring the meal-plans BFF using RED method.

h2. Tasks

* Create dashboard using HF Grafana templates
* Add RED metrics panels (Rate, Errors, Duration)
* Add resource utilization panels (CPU, Memory)
* Add custom business metrics panels
* Configure dashboard variables (environment, instance)

h2. Dashboard Panels

# Request Rate (requests/sec)
# Error Rate (%)
# Latency (p50, p95, p99)
# CPU Usage
# Memory Usage
# Active connections
# Downstream service latency (NMPS)

h2. Reference

* [HF RED Dashboards|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/metrics-automation/docs/05-FAQ/02-red-method/]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Dashboard created in Grafana
* [ ] RED metrics visible and accurate
* [ ] Resource metrics displayed
* [ ] Dashboard accessible to Pet Food squad

h2. Dependencies

* Integrate metrics module in meal-plans app
* Deploy to staging environment

issues.summary: Document configuration values
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create comprehensive documentation for all configuration options. (Per APP)

h2. Tasks

* Add CONFIG.md or section in README
* Document each environment variable
* Include default values and valid ranges
* Provide examples for different environments
* Document secret management procedures

h2. Documentation Format

||Variable||Description||Required||Default||Example||
|PORT|Server port|No|3000|8080|

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] All config variables documented
* [ ] Required vs optional clearly marked
* [ ] Examples for local/staging/prod
* [ ] Secret handling documented

h2. Dependencies

* Create configuration interface and module

issues.summary: Integrate Vault secrets for staging and production
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Configure the BFF to read secrets from Vault (existing namespace) in deployed environments.

h2. Tasks

* Configure Vault Secrets Operator integration in OAM
* Map Vault secrets to environment variables
* Set up different secret paths for staging/prod
* Test secret injection in staging environment
* Document secret management process

h2. Technical Details

* Vault namespace already exists (confirmed)
* Use Vault Secrets Operator for K8s secret sync
* Secrets injected as environment variables

h2. Secrets Required

* JWT signing key
* NMPS API credentials (if any)
* Any third-party API keys

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Secrets injected from Vault in staging
* [ ] Secrets injected from Vault in production
* [ ] No secrets in code or config files
* [ ] Secret rotation process documented

h2. Dependencies

* Create FTCP OAM manifest for staging

issues.summary: Configure progressive delivery (canary deployment)
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Set up canary deployment strategy for safe production rollouts.

h2. Tasks

* Configure Argo Rollouts in OAM manifest
* Define canary steps (10% ‚Üí 50% ‚Üí 100%)
* Set up automatic rollback on error rate threshold
* Configure analysis templates for canary validation
* Add manual promotion gates if needed

h2. Technical Details

* Use Argo Rollouts for progressive delivery
* Monitor error rate and latency during canary
* Automatic rollback if SLO breached

h2. Reference

* [HF Progressive Delivery Docs|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/progressive-delivery/docs]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Canary deployment configured in OAM
* [ ] Automatic rollback on failures
* [ ] Metrics monitored during rollout
* [ ] Manual promotion option available

h2. Dependencies

* Create FTCP OAM manifest for production
* Configure ArgoCD deployment workflow

issues.summary: Set up feature flags integration
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Integrate feature flag system for gradual rollout control of BFF endpoints.

h2. Tasks

* Research HF feature flag system/provider
* Add feature flag client to shared modules
* Create feature flags for gradual traffic shifting
* Implement flag checks in controllers/services
* Document feature flag usage patterns

h2. Use Cases

* Enable/disable specific endpoints
* Gradual rollout of new features
* A/B testing capabilities
* Emergency kill switch

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Feature flag client integrated
* [ ] Flags configurable without deployment
* [ ] Flag state logged for debugging
* [ ] Documentation for creating new flags

h2. Dependencies

* TPT-2457 (Restructure repository to monorepo)

issues.summary: Configure environment overrides for FTCP
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create environment-specific override files for staging and production deployments.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{environment.stage.override.yaml}}
* Create {{environment.prod.override.yaml}}
* Configure environment-specific values (URLs, feature flags)
* Set up different log levels per environment
* Configure environment-specific resource scaling

h2. Technical Details

* Staging: verbose logging, lower resources
* Production: info logging, higher resources, stricter limits

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Override files for both environments
* [ ] Environment-specific configs clearly separated
* [ ] No production secrets in staging config
* [ ] Overrides apply correctly during deployment

h2. Dependencies

* Create FTCP OAM manifest for staging

issues.summary: Create FTCP OAM manifest for production
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create FTCP Open Application Model (OAM) manifest for deploying meal-plans BFF to production environment.

h2. Tasks

* Create OAM application manifest for production
* Configure production resource limits (higher than staging)
* Set up replica count for high availability
* Configure production Vault secrets path
* Enable pod disruption budget
* Configure horizontal pod autoscaling (HPA)

h2. Technical Details

* Minimum 2 replicas for HA
* Configure HPA based on CPU/memory thresholds
* Set appropriate resource limits for production load

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Production manifest with HA configuration
* [ ] HPA configured for auto-scaling
* [ ] Pod disruption budget prevents full outage
* [ ] Production secrets configured correctly

h2. Dependencies

* Create FTCP OAM manifest for staging

issues.summary: Create FTCP OAM manifest for staging
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create FTCP Open Application Model (OAM) manifest for deploying meal-plans BFF to staging environment.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{apps/meal-plans/deployment/}} directory
* Create OAM application manifest for staging
* Configure resource limits (CPU, memory)
* Set up environment variables from Vault
* Configure service port and health check paths
* Add necessary FTCP traits (logging, metrics, tracing)

h2. Technical Details

* Follow FTCP OAM structure per HF standards
* Configure appropriate replica count for staging (1-2)
* Set resource requests/limits based on expected load

h2. Reference

* [FTCP Documentation|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/fault-tolerant-container-platform/docs/ftcp-open-application-model]
* [ADR Structure|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/5643894810]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] OAM manifest validates against schema
* [ ] Manifest includes all required traits
* [ ] Environment variables configured from Vault
* [ ] Health check endpoints configured

h2. Dependencies

* TPT-2457 (Restructure repository to monorepo)

issues.summary: Create OpenAPI documentation module
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create a shared NestJS module for automatic OpenAPI/Swagger documentation generation.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{packages/shared/modules/openapi/}} module
* Configure @nestjs/swagger integration
* Set up Swagger UI at {{/docs}} endpoint
* Configure API metadata (title, version, description)
* Add authentication documentation
* Export OpenAPI JSON at {{/docs/json}}

h2. Technical Details

* Use decorators: @ApiTags, @ApiOperation, @ApiResponse
* Document all DTOs with @ApiProperty
* Include JWT bearer auth in security schemes
* *It would be much easier to use auth generation plugin from NestJS*

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Swagger UI accessible at {{/docs}}
* [ ] All endpoints documented
* [ ] Request/response schemas generated from DTOs
* [ ] Authentication requirements documented

h2. Dependencies

* TPT-2457 (Restructure repository to monorepo)

issues.summary: Create error handling module
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create a shared NestJS module for consistent error handling across all BFFs.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{packages/shared/modules/error-handling/}} module
* Implement global exception filter
* Define standardized error response format
* Map NestJS exceptions to HTTP status codes
* Integrate error logging with logging module
* Handle validation errors with detailed messages

h2. Technical Details

* Error response format:

{code:json}{
  "error": "Bad Request",
  "message": "Validation failed",
  "details": [...],
  "correlationId": "xxx" (or in headers)
}{code}

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] All exceptions caught by global filter
* [ ] Consistent error response format
* [ ] Errors logged with full context
* [ ] Stack traces hidden in production

h2. Dependencies

* Create logging module with correlation IDs

issues.summary: Create tracing module (OpenTelemetry)
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create a shared NestJS module for distributed tracing using OpenTelemetry.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{packages/shared/modules/tracing/}} module
* Configure OpenTelemetry SDK for Node.js
* Set up OTLP exporter for trace collection
* Auto-instrument HTTP incoming/outgoing requests
* Propagate trace context via W3C headers
* Configure sampling strategy

h2. Technical Details

* Use {{@opentelemetry/sdk-node}} and related packages
* Configure service name and version from environment
* Integrate with correlation ID from logging module

h2. Reference

* [HF Tracing Documentation|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/prometheus/docs/thanos/observability/03-Distributed-Traces/]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Traces exported to HF tracing infrastructure
* [ ] HTTP requests automatically traced
* [ ] Trace context propagated to downstream services
* [ ] Trace ID visible in logs

h2. Dependencies

* TPT-2457 (Restructure repository to monorepo)

issues.summary: Create metrics module (Prometheus)
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create a shared NestJS module for exposing Prometheus metrics.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{packages/shared/modules/metrics/}} module
* Integrate {{prom-client}} library
* Expose {{/metrics}} endpoint for Prometheus scraping
* Add default HTTP metrics (request count, duration, status codes)
* Add Node.js runtime metrics (memory, CPU, event loop)
* Create helpers for custom business metrics

h2. Technical Details

* Use histogram for request duration (RED method)
* Label metrics with: method, path, status_code
* Configure metric prefix for namespace

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] {{/metrics}} endpoint returns Prometheus format
* [ ] HTTP request metrics collected automatically
* [ ] Custom metric registration API available
* [ ] Metrics compatible with HF Grafana dashboards

h2. Dependencies

* TPT-2457 (Restructure repository to monorepo)

issues.summary: Create logging module with correlation IDs
issues.description:
h2. Objective

Create a shared NestJS module for structured logging with automatic correlation ID tracking.

h2. Tasks

* Create {{packages/shared/modules/logging/}} module
* Integrate Pino logger for structured JSON output
* Auto-extract correlation ID from {{x-correlation-id}} header
* Generate correlation ID if not present in request
* Propagate correlation ID to outgoing HTTP requests
* Configure log levels based on environment

h2. Technical Details

* Use {{nestjs-pino}} or custom Pino integration
* Output format compatible with Loki ingestion
* Include request metadata (method, path, duration)

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] Logging module exportable from shared package
* [ ] Correlation ID automatically added to all logs
* [ ] JSON structured output for production
* [ ] Pretty print for local development

h2. Dependencies

* TPT-2457 (Restructure repository to monorepo)
